PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ida Freeman, 2806 Bentley Drive, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 4, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe that Negro communities actually choose their leaders or do they accept the leadership, which 'the powers-that-be' select and 'hand' to them?"  Answer reads: "I think that when they have a chance to do so, they choose their own leaders. They seem to be always trying to vote for the person who will make a good leader."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ida Freeman wearing dark coat with plush collar, standing in between store windows, including one on left with display that reads "Joseph Deroy for Gift..."
